name: Kepler-261
scenarioDescription:
The Kepler-261 Exoplanetary System

Kepler-261 is a star with 0.685 times the mass of the Sun, and 0.79 times its radius. It is located 1045.10 light years away from the solar system.

Kepler-261 is known to have 2 exoplanets in orbit around it.

Kepler-261 b

Kepler-261 b was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.09 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 10.38 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-261.

The mass of Kepler-261 b is 6.21 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-261 b is 2.18 that of Earth. At 6.21 Earth masses, Kepler-261 b is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.

Kepler-261 c

Kepler-261 c was discovered by the Kepler observatory using the transit method. Its discovery was announced in 2014-03. Its semi-major axis is 0.16 astronomical units, as compared to Earth's which is 1 astronomical unit. It takes 24.57 Earth days to complete an orbit around its host star, Kepler-261.

The mass of Kepler-261 c is 5.05 times the mass of Earth. The radius of Kepler-261 c is 2 that of Earth. At 5.05 Earth masses, Kepler-261 c is a so called Super Earth. Super Earths could be terrestrial worlds like Earth, but they could also be ocean worlds or terrestrial worlds wrapped in a substantial atmosphere, in which case some refer to them as Mini Neptunes. No Super Earths are known to exist in our solar system, but if it exists, the so-called Planet Nine could very well be a super Earth, as it is hypothesized to have a mass between five and ten Earth masses.
description: 3D visualisation and gravity simulation of the exoplanet system Kepler-261, which contains 2 planets and was discovered by Kepler.
